statement.p: A relationship between the outer \displaystyle{D}_{{o}} and pitch \displaystyle{D}_{{p}} diameters of a gear and the number of teeth \displaystyle{N} is given by \displaystyle{D}_{{p}}={\frac{{{D}_{{o}}{N}}}{{{N}+{2}}}}.
If a gear needs \displaystyle{N}={26} teeth and pitch diameter \displaystyle{D}_{{p}}={34} mm, what should the outer diameter be? Note that both measurement are given to two significant digits.
